answers.answer: If you have confidence in Dr Friedman you should ask him to recommend someone on the east coast that he is confident about.If that leads you nowhere I recommend you approach a pituitary surgery center in a leading hospital near where you live as they often have endos skilled in pituitary problems working in those units.Try either of those suggestions first.
He should have a list of doctors - and there are a few on the east coast that follow his same philosophy.

Thanks Low Cortisol & Rumpled for the good suggestions.Do any of you personally know of any good Endo's in the area that you can recommend?  Personal experience always helps.I new for many years I had pituitary failure and thought once I was diagnosed and on meds, life would be easier.  Boy was i wrong!

I have no direct experience with endos in the tri state area as I live in Australia, but have the very highest regard for NYU. I had emergency surgery there 3 yrs ago and the competence and care I experienced was outstanding.If I were you I would contact or google the Division of Endocrinology at NYU Langone Medical Center on First Avenue in Manhattan. Ask for an endo skilled in pituitary disorders.

question: I live in the NY Ct NJ area and traveled to L.A to see Dr theodore Friedman for a diagnosis after many disappointment on the east coast.  Turns out I am Hypopit and have a growth hormone deficiency and mild diabetes insipidus.  I'm on HGH replacement as well as other hormone replacement and am being monitored by my local Endo here.  While I feel he's doing the best he can, he's out of his league.  Also it's not possible for me to fly back and forth to L.A to see Friedman.  I need a Dr on the east coast to monitor my HGH which I think is not working to the best of its abilities.  My IGF1 is still low after almost 2 yrs and if I increase I get fluid buildup.I hope someone here can help me.  I'm a 60 something female but i look older and feel worse!  Thanks for any help.
title: Desperately seeking a Dr Friedman-east
